00018 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count, double scale, double offset )
00019 {
00020     LOG( Runtime, info )
00021             << "using generic scaling convert " << ValuePtr<SRC>::staticName() << "=>" << ValuePtr<DST>::staticName()
00022             << " with scale/offset " << std::fixed << scale << "/" << offset;
00023     static boost::numeric::converter <
00024     DST, double,
00025        boost::numeric::conversion_traits<DST, double>,
00026        boost::numeric::def_overflow_handler,
00027        boost::numeric::RoundEven<double>
00028        > converter;
00029 
00030     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ ) {
00031         dst[i] = converter( src[i] * scale + offset );
00032     }
00033 }
00034 
00035 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count )
00036 {
00037     LOG( Runtime, info ) << "using generic convert " << ValuePtr<SRC>::staticName() << " => " << ValuePtr<DST>::staticName() << " without scaling";
00038     static boost::numeric::converter <
00039     DST, SRC,
00040        boost::numeric::conversion_traits<DST, SRC>,
00041        boost::numeric::def_overflow_handler,
00042        boost::numeric::RoundEven<SRC>
00043        > converter;
00044 
00045     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ )
00046         dst[i] = converter( src[i] );
00047 }

00049 template<typename T> void numeric_copy_impl( const T *src, T *dst, size_t count )
00050 {
00051     LOG( Runtime, info )    << "using memcpy-copy of " << ValuePtr<T>::staticName() << " without scaling";
00052     memcpy( dst, src, count * sizeof( T ) );
00053 }
00054 template<typename T> void numeric_copy_impl( const T *src, T *dst, size_t count, double scale, double offset )
00055 {
00056     LOG( Runtime, info )    << "using generic scaling copy of " << ValuePtr<T>::staticName() << " with scale/offset " << std::fixed << scale << "/" << offset;
00057 
00058     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ )
00059         dst[i] = src[i] * scale + offset;
00060 }

00184 
00202 template<typename SRC, typename DST> std::pair<double, double>
00203 getNumericScaling( const util::_internal::ValueBase &min, const util::_internal::ValueBase &max, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )
00204 {
00205     double scale = 1.0;
00206     double offset = 0.0;
00207     bool doScale = ( scaleopt != noscale && std::numeric_limits<DST>::is_integer ); //only do scale if scaleopt!=noscale and the target is an integer (scaling into float is useless)
00208 
00209     if ( scaleopt == autoscale && std::numeric_limits<SRC>::is_integer ) {
00210         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Won't upscale, because the source datatype is discrete (" << util::Value<SRC>::staticName() << ")";
00211         scaleopt = noupscale; //dont scale up if SRC is an integer
00212     }
00213 
00214     if ( doScale ) {
00215         const DST domain_min = std::numeric_limits<DST>::min();//negative value domain of this dst
00216         const DST domain_max = std::numeric_limits<DST>::max();//positive value domain of this dst
00217         double minval, maxval;
00218         minval = min.as<double>();
00219         maxval = max.as<double>();
00220         assert( minval < maxval );
00221         LOG( Debug, info ) << "src Range:" << minval << "=>" << maxval;
00222         LOG( Debug, info ) << "dst Domain:" << domain_min << "=>" << domain_max;
00223         assert( domain_min < domain_max );//we also should assume this
00224         //set offset for src
00225         //if all src is completly on positive domain, or if there is no negative domain use minval
00226         //else if src is completly on negative dmain, or if there is no positive domain use maxval
00227         //elsewise leave it at 0 and scale both sides
00228         if ( minval > 0 || !domain_min ) {
00229             if ( ( maxval - domain_max ) > 0 ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00230                 offset = -minval;
00231         } else if ( ( 0 - maxval ) > 0 || !domain_max ) {
00232             if ( ( domain_min - minval ) > 0  ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00233                 offset = -maxval;
00234         }
00235 
00236         //calculate range of values which will be on postive/negative domain when offset is applied
00237         const double range_max = maxval + offset; //allways >=0
00238         const double range_min = minval + offset; //allways <=0
00239         //set scaling factor to fit src-range into dst domain
00240         //some compilers dont make x/0 = inf, so we use std::numeric_limits<double>::max() instead, in this case
00241         const double scale_max =
00242             range_max != 0 ? domain_max / range_max :
00243             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00244         const double scale_min =
00245             range_min != 0 ? domain_min / range_min :
00246             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00247         scale = std::min( scale_max ? scale_max : std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), scale_min ? scale_min : std::numeric_limits<double>::max() );//get the smaller scaling factor which is not zero so the bigger range will fit into his domain
00248 
00249         if ( scale < 1 ) {
00250             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Downscaling your values by Factor " << scale << " you might lose information.";
00251         } else if ( scaleopt == noupscale ) {
00252             if ( scale > 1 ) {
00253                 LOG( Runtime, info ) << "upscale not given, clamping scale " << scale << " to 1";
00254                 scale = 1;
00255             }
00256         }
00257 
00258         offset *= scale;//calc offset for dst
00259     }
00260 
00261     return std::make_pair( scale, offset );
00262 }
00263 
00279 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert( const ValuePtr<SRC> &src, ValuePtr<DST> &dst, const double scale, const double offset )
00280 {
00281     LOG_IF( src.getLength() > dst.getLength(), Runtime, error ) << "The " << src.getLength() << " elements of src wont fit into the destination. Will only convert " << dst.getLength() << " elements.";
00282     LOG_IF( src.getLength() < dst.getLength(), Runtime, warning ) << "Source is shorter than destination. Will only convert " << src.getLength() << " values";
00283 
00284     if ( src.getLength() == 0 )return;
00285 
00286     const size_t size = std::min( src.getLength(), dst.getLength() );
00287 
00288     if ( ( scale != 1. || offset ) )
00289         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size, scale, offset );
00290     else
00291         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size );
00292 }
00293 template<typename T> void numeric_copy( const ValuePtr<T> &src, ValuePtr<T> &dst, const double scale, const double offset )
00294 {
00295     LOG_IF( src.getLength() > dst.getLength(), Runtime, error ) << "The " << src.getLength() << " elements of src wont fit into the destination. Will only convert " << dst.getLength() << " elements.";
00296     LOG_IF( src.getLength() < dst.getLength(), Runtime, warning ) << "Source is shorter than destination. Will only convert " << src.getLength() << " values";
00297 
00298     if ( src.getLength() == 0 )return;
00299 
00300     const size_t size = std::min( src.getLength(), dst.getLength() );
00301 
00302     if ( ( scale != 1. || offset ) )
00303         _internal::numeric_copy_impl<T>( &src[0], &dst[0], size, scale, offset );
00304     else
00305         _internal::numeric_copy_impl<T>( &src[0], &dst[0], size );
00306 }

00308 }
